text: Solving Diophantine Equations : Problems for Practice 1. Find all integer solutions of x + y = x2 − xy + y2. 2. Find all positive integers x and y that satisfy the equation 3 x − 2 y = 7. 3. Find all pairs of positive integers (x, y) such that x2 − y! = 2001. 4. Show that the equation a3 + (a + 1)3 + · · · + (a + 6)3 = b4 + (b + 1)4 has no solutions in integers a, b. 5. What is the smallest positive integer n such that there exist integers x1, x2, . . . , xn with x3 1 + x3 2 + . . . + x3 n = 2002 2002 ? 6. Find all m, n ∈ N and primes p ≥ 5 satisfying m(4m 2 + m + 12) = 3(pn − 1). 7. Prove that the equation x2 + 2y2 + 98z2 = 11 · · · 1| {z } 666 times does not have integer solutions. 8. Find all pairs (p, n) of positive integers where p is a prime number and p3 −p = n 7 − n 3. 9. Prove that there are no integers x, y for which x3 + 3xy − 2y2 = 122. 10. Find all non-negative integer solutions to the equation 3 x − y3 = 1. 11. Find all positive integers x, y, z, t, and n satisfying n x + ny + n z = nt. 12. Show that there are inﬁnitely many tuples (a, b, c, d) of natural numbers such that a3 + b4 + c5 = d7. 13. Prove that the equation x2 + y2 + 1 = z2 has inﬁnitely many integer solutions. 14. (a) Let n be a positive integer. Prove that there exist distinct positive integers x, y, z such that xn−1 + yn = zn+1. (b) Let a, b, c be positive integers such that a and b are relatively prime and c is relatively prime either to a or to b. Prove that there exist inﬁnitely many triples (x, y, z) of distinct positive integers x, y, z such that xa + yb = zc. 15. Show that the equation xx + yy = zz does not admit positive integer solutions. 16. Find all non-negative integer solutions to the equation 5 x7 y + 4 = 3 z. 17. Determine all pairs (x, y) of positive integers such that x2y + x + y is divisible by xy2 + y + 7. 18. Determine all pairs (x, y) of integers such that 1 + 2x + 22x+1 = y2. 19. Determine all pairs of positive integers (a, b) such that a2 2ab2 − b3 + 1 is a positive integer. 20. Prove that if n is a positive integer such that the equation x3 − 3xy2 + y3 = n has a solution in integers x, y, then it has at least three such solutions. Show that the equation has no solutions in integers for n = 2891.
